homes_hear_details: Georgia has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The Georgia Environmental Finance Authority (GEFA) is the designated state entity working with the U.S. Department of Energy on program design and implementation.

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Georgia, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Fulton County (Atlanta), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $62,250.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Georgia, 150% of Area Median Income in Fulton County (Atlanta) for a family of four is approximately $116,700.

net_metering: Georgia does not have a statewide net metering mandate. Georgia Power offers a renewable and nonrenewable resource program for customers with solar (up to 10 kW for residential). Under the Georgia Power tariff, excess generation is credited at an avoided cost rate, which is significantly below retail. Some electric membership cooperatives (EMCs) offer their own distributed generation policies.

state_rebate_programs.name: Georgia Sales Tax Exemption for Solar Energy Equipment
state_rebate_programs.amount: Exemption from state sales tax on solar energy equipment (state portion only)
state_rebate_programs.details: Georgia provides a sales tax exemption for solar energy equipment purchased for residential use. Local sales taxes may still apply depending on the jurisdiction.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Georgia Environmental Finance Authority (GEFA), through community action agencies
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, HVAC repair/replacement, duct sealing, window repair, lighting upgrades
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level.

programs.name: Home Energy Improvement Program (HEIP)
programs.amount: Free home energy assessment; rebates up to $2,000 for qualifying improvements
programs.eligible_items: Insulation, HVAC upgrades, duct sealing, air sealing, windows (requires home energy audit)

programs.name: Residential Thermostat Rebate
programs.amount: Up to $50 for qualifying smart thermostats

programs.name: Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Varies by measure; up to $250 for HVAC tune-up, up to $500 for heat pump
programs.eligible_items: ENERGY STAR rated HVAC systems, heat pumps, water heaters, duct sealing

programs.name: Right Choice Rebate Program
programs.amount: Varies; up to $600 for qualifying heat pumps
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, heat pump water heaters, smart thermostats, whole-house efficiency improvements

programs.name: Residential Rebate Program
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, ENERGY STAR appliances, smart thermostats, water heaters

programs.name: Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Varies; up to $500 for heat pumps
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, heat pump water heaters, smart thermostats
